text: Store Strandstræde 7 is a small building located close to Kongens Nytorv central Copenhagen, Denmark. The building was listed on the Danish registry of protected buildings and places in 1989. ==History== Advertisement for Julius Ågård Store Strandstræde 7 seen on a photograph by Johannes Hauerslev Store Strandstræde 7 was built in 1781 for turner Søren Nielsen Nygaard. Clockmaker Julius Aagaard (22 November 1822 - 12 February 1897) owned the building from 1851 to 1896 and ran his clock business from the premises. The writer Kjeld Abell (1901-1961) lived on the second floor from 1955 to 1961. ==Architecture== The building is just three bays wide. A five-bay sidewing extends from the rear side of the building. It is connected to a two-bay rear wing. ==See also== * Axel E. Aamodts lithografiske Etablissement ==References== ==Rxternal links== Category:Listed residential buildings in Copenhagen Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1718 Category:1781 establishments in Denmark
title: Store Strandstræde 7
